pullRequest.title: [HUDI-319] Add a new maven profile to generate unified Javadoc for all Java and Scala classes
pullRequest.bodyText:
What is the purpose of the pull request
This PR adds a new maven profile to generate unified Javadoc for all Java and Scala classes.  Given that most modules have Java classes only, and only two modules, hudi-spark and hudi-cli, have Scala source code (only a few files), it is better to put the apidocs of all classes in one place.
Since most classes are in Java, the Javadoc is chosen to generate the apidocs, with genjavadoc-plugin to translate Scaladoc comments into Java source so that the javadoc tool can recognize them.
Brief change log

Add a new maven profile javadocs to generate unified Javadoc at the project root.  By running mvn clean javadoc:aggregate -Pjavadocs, the apidocs pages are generated under target/site/apidocs.
Add documentation in README.md regarding the above.
Fix one issue in IncrementalRelation.scala that caused the following error while generating the Javadoc:

[ERROR] /Users/yihua/tech/repo/incubator-hudi/hudi-spark/target/genjavadoc/org/apache/hudi/IncrementalRelation.java:[17,58] type argument scala.runtime.Nothing$ is not within bounds of type-variable T

Screenshots showing Java and Scala classes in the same apidocs:
AvroConversionHelper.scala

BaseAvroPayload.java

Verify this pull request
This PR only adds new maven profile and can be verified by running: mvn clean javadoc:aggregate -Pjavadocs
Committer checklist


 Has a corresponding JIRA in PR title & commit


 Commit message is descriptive of the change


 CI is green


 Necessary doc changes done or have another open PR


 For large changes, please consider breaking it into sub-tasks under an umbrella JIRA.

commit.message: [HUDI-319] Add a new maven profile to generate unified javadoc for all java and scala classes
Add javadoc build command in README, links to javadoc plugin and rename profile.
Make java version configurable in one place.
